sense.name: (Cause to) become hot or dry, singed, burned slight, destroy (as if) by fire
sense.examples: The heat scorched the countryside. The exposed tree scorched in the hot sun. My eyebrows scorched the hair on my arm. The flames scorched the ceiling. The shirt was scorched a nasty yellow color. The cook scorched the chicken for his blackened chicken salad. The wildfire scorched the forest and several villages. The invaders scorched the land.
